description.para: Sensitive variables that should not be modified.

briefdescription.para: the 3x3 inertia and center of mass of the link in the link's coordinate system

detaileddescription.para: triangles for collision checking, triangles are always the triangulation of the body when it is at the identity transformation

briefdescription.para: optional link name
pass in a ODE world
Indicates a static body that does not move with respect to the root link.

detaileddescription.para: Static should be used when an object has infinite mass and shouldn't be affected by physics (including gravity). Collision still works.

briefdescription.para: returns true if the link is enabled.
Enables a Link. An enabled link takes part in collision detection and physics simulations.
parent body that link belong to.
unique index into parent KinBody::GetLinks vector
Compute the aabb of all the geometries of the link in the world coordinate system.
Return the current transformation of the link in the world coordinate system.
Return all the direct parent links in the kinematics hierarchy of this link.

detaileddescription.para:
A parent link is is immediately connected to this link by a joint and has a path to the root joint so that it is possible to compute this link's transformation from its parent.
filled
with the parent links

briefdescription.para: Tests if a link is a direct parent.

parameterdescription.para: The link to test if it is one of the parents of this link.

simplesect.para: center of mass offset in the link's local coordinate frame

briefdescription.para: sets a link to be static.

detaileddescription.para: Because this can affect the kinematics, it requires the body's internal structures to be recomputed

briefdescription.para: Sets the transform of the link regardless of kinematics.

detaileddescription.para:
adds an external force at pos (absolute coords)
force
the direction and magnitude of the force
pos
in the world where the force is getting applied
add
if true, force is added to previous forces, otherwise it is set

adds torque to a body (absolute coords)
add
if true, torque is added to previous torques, otherwise it is set

forces the velocity of the link
linearvel
the translational velocity
angularvel
is the rotation axis * angular speed

get the velocity of the link
linearvel
the translational velocity
angularvel
is the rotation axis * angular speed

briefdescription.para: returns a list of all the geometry objects.
swaps the current geometries with the new geometries.

detaileddescription.para: This gives a user control for dynamically changing the object geometry. Note that the kinbody/robot hash could change.

validates the contact normal on link and makes sure the normal faces "outside" of the geometry shape it lies on. An exception can be thrown if position is not on a geometry surface
position
the position of the contact point specified in the link's coordinate system, assumes it is on a particular geometry
normal
the unit normal of the contact point specified in the link's coordinate system
true if the normal is changed to face outside of the shape

briefdescription.para: returns true if plink is rigidily attahced to this link.
Gets all the rigidly attached links to linkindex, also adds the link to the list.

parameterdescription.para: the array to insert all links attached to linkindex with the link itself.

briefdescription.para: Updates the cached information due to changes in the collision data.
A rigid body holding all its collision and rendering data.
